title: Blink-182’s Mark Hoppus Says He Once Went on an ‘Awful’ Date With Melissa Joan Hart
description: Just hours after the date, he connected with his future wife Skye.
author: Rania Aniftos
excerpt: Blink-182 star Mark Hoppus recalled an "awful" date he went on with Melissa Joan Hart before he connected with his future wife Skye.
text: Just hours after the date, he connected with his future wife Skye. Mark Hoppus from Blink-182 performs during the first week-end of Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival in Indio, California, on April 14, 2023. Valerie Macon/AFP via Getty Images When one door closes, another one opens in the world of romance. Mark Hoppus learned that after going on an unsuccessful date with Melissa Joan Hart. The Blink-182 rocker opened up about the dinner with the Sabrina the Teenage Witch star in his upcoming memoir, Fahrenheit-182, according to People. In the book, he says the two had sushi together in the San Fernando Valley, but the spark just wasn’t there. “It was an awful date. She was very nice, but we weren’t connecting,” he wrote. “Everything in her life revolved around acting and it was hard to relate to her about anything else.” Explore See latest videos, charts and news As examples, Hoppus said that Joan said she ate whatever was catered on set when asked about her favorite foods, and that she likes to read scripts when asked what she likes to read. “I’m sure from her perspective, all I could talk about was music,” he explained. “We just weren’t a good match. The longtime couple share 22-year-old son, Jack. Things also worked out for Hart in the romance department, as she married her husband Mark Wilkerson in 2003. html:
Just hours after the date, he connected with his future wife Skye.

When one door closes, another one opens in the world of romance. Mark Hoppus learned that after going on an unsuccessful date with Melissa Joan Hart.

The Blink-182 rocker opened up about the dinner with the Sabrina the Teenage Witch star in his upcoming memoir, Fahrenheit-182, according to People. In the book, he says the two had sushi together in the San Fernando Valley, but the spark just wasn’t there. “It was an awful date. She was very nice, but we weren’t connecting,” he wrote. “Everything in her life revolved around acting and it was hard to relate to her about anything else.”

As examples, Hoppus said that Joan said she ate whatever was catered on set when asked about her favorite foods, and that she likes to read scripts when asked what she likes to read. “I’m sure from her perspective, all I could talk about was music,” he explained. “We just weren’t a good match. It was tough.”

Trending on Billboard

However, when he returned home for the evening, he had a voicemail from an MTV talent executive named Skye that he had a crush on. She previously rejected his romantic advances, but when he caled her back that night, they talked all night long. Less than a year later, in 2000, they tied the knot. The longtime couple share 22-year-old son, Jack.

Things also worked out for Hart in the romance department, as she married her husband Mark Wilkerson in 2003. They have three sons: 19-year-old Mason, 17-year-old Braydon and 12-year-old Tucker.

Hoppus’ Fahrenheit-182 is out April 8.
